intro: Lasiocephalus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive head grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant has narrow, bluish-green leaves and produces small, spikelet-like inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. Due to its unique appearance and growth patterns, it is sometimes mistaken for other grass species in its environment.
